title: 111_hr6556
content: The Act is titled the "Emergency Unemployment Compensation Expansion Act" and includes a temporary extension of unemployment insurance provisions. The Emergency Unemployment Compensation Expansion Act extends unemployment insurance provisions by amending various dates in existing laws. The Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2008 is amended to change the date from April 30, 2011, to June 10, 2012. Funding provisions are also amended to include additional sections. The effective date for these amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2010. SEC. 3. TEMPORARY MODIFICATION OF INDICATORS UNDER THE EXTENDED BENEFIT PROGRAM. The Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 is amended to allow states to adjust indicators for extended benefit periods. The Act also introduces an alternative trigger for determining eligibility. The Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 is amended to allow states to adjust indicators for extended benefit periods. Effective from the date of enactment of the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Expansion Act until December 31, 2011, states may modify the criteria for determining extended benefit periods. SEC. 4. ADDITIONAL FIRST-TIER EMERGENCY UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION. Amendment to the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008 increases entitlement to emergency unemployment compensation. Coordination rule added for prompt payment of benefits. The Amendment to the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008 allows states to pay second-tier emergency unemployment compensation before increased first-tier benefits to avoid delays. States can consider exhaustion of increased first-tier benefits as exhaustion of second-tier benefits for eligibility for third-tier benefits. The amendments made by this section regarding emergency unemployment compensation shall take effect retroactively to the Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2010. No additional first-tier benefits will be payable beyond the maximum amount before the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5 amends a section of the Claims Resolution Act of 2010 by changing "or" to "and". The amendment is retroactive. SEC. 6 provides additional extended unemployment benefits under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act. The Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act is amended to extend the deadline for benefits to June 30, 2011, and December 31, 2011. Funds can be used to cover the cost of additional extended benefits. The Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act is amended to extend benefits to June 30, 2011, and December 31, 2011, including benefits provided under section 2(c)(2)(D) before the enactment of this Act.
